htmlContent:
Next.js Guide

Next.js is a powerful React framework for building production-ready web applications with server-side rendering, static site generation, and flexible API routes. It integrates seamlessly with React and TailwindCSS to build performant, scalable, and SEO-friendly applications.

Key Features

  • SSR (Server-Side Rendering) for dynamic pages
  • SSG (Static Site Generation) for static content
  • Dynamic Routes & API Routes for backend integration
  • Built-in CSS, Sass, and TailwindCSS support
  • Next/Image component for optimized images
  • Incremental Static Regeneration (ISR) for updates without rebuilds

Best Practices

  • Use getStaticProps and getServerSideProps appropriately
  • Organize API routes and pages for maintainability
  • Leverage ISR to update static pages incrementally
  • Optimize performance and SEO for production apps
  • Use TailwindCSS classes consistently for responsive UI

Example: API Route

export default function handler(req, res) {
  res.status(200).json({ message: 'Hello from Next.js API route!' });
}

Next Steps

  • Integrate Next.js with React state management (Redux, Zustand, or Context API)
  • Deploy applications on Vercel for serverless SSR and API routes
  • Implement authentication and role-based access control
  • Use TailwindCSS for responsive UI across all devices
  • Add analytics, monitoring, and SEO optimizations

By following these best practices, you can build fast, scalable, and maintainable full-stack applications using Next.js and React.
